body.p: The IASB also decided that, if the transfer of the asset does not meet the requirements for a transfer in IFRS 15, then no sale is recognised by the seller-lessee and no purchase is recognised by the buyer-lessor. Instead, the seller-lessee and buyer-lessor will account for any amounts received or paid relating to the leaseback as a financial asset or a financial liability applying IFRS 9. This is because such a transaction represents, in substance, a financing arrangement.
